实战教程：开发 CRUD 功能

Tagtag adopts a modern architecture with separation of frontend and backend. The frontend handles user interaction and interface display, while the backend is responsible for business logic and data processing. The system is designed with modularity, high cohesion, and low coupling principles for easy extension and maintenance. Simply put, it's about clarifying responsibilities - each part does its job without interfering with others.
The Tagtag system consists of two main parts:

directory. A modern Single Page Application (SPA) built with Vue 3 + Vite + TypeScript, adopting the Vben Admin 5 framework, and using Tailwind CSS and Shadcn UI for interface development. Beautiful interface, smooth interaction, and top-notch user experience.
: Multiple Java modules located in the

directory. A modular application built with Spring Boot, responsible for providing RESTful APIs and data persistence services. Stable, reliable, and excellent performance - like a hardworking ox that never complains.
: Frontend and backend communicate via HTTP/HTTPS protocol using RESTful API style. Simple, standard, and easy to understand.
: JSON is used as the standard data exchange format. Lightweight, readable, and easy to parse.
: Stateless authentication using JWT (JSON Web Token). Secure, efficient, and stateless.
User accesses the frontend application, enters username and password
Frontend calls the login API, sends authentication request
Backend verifies username and password, generates JWT token
Frontend stores JWT token, carries token in subsequent requests
This process is like withdrawing money from a bank - first verify your identity, get a voucher, and then you can handle business with that voucher.
Frontend initiates API request, carries JWT token
Controller receives request, calls service layer to process business logic
Service layer calls data layer to access database
Data layer returns results, service layer encapsulates business response
Controller returns JSON response to frontend

This flow is like ordering food delivery - you place an order (frontend request), the merchant accepts it (controller), the chef cooks (service layer), packaging (data layer), delivery (return response), and finally you receive your food (frontend processing).
Frontend establishes WebSocket connection, carries authentication information
Both parties exchange real-time data via WebSocket
This is like making a phone call - once the connection is established, both parties can talk anytime without redialing.

Modern Java application development framework, providing auto-configuration, embedded server and other features to simplify development process. Lets developers focus on business logic, not configuration files.
LTS version, providing better performance, security and new feature support. Use the latest technology to write the most stable code.
Simplifies MyBatis development, provides code generation, pagination plugin, logical deletion and other functions. Write less code, do more work (just kidding).
Used for caching, session management and distributed locks to improve system performance. Make the system fly.
Powerful security framework, supporting JWT authentication and permission control. Security first, don't let hackers find opportunities.
Stable and reliable relational database, suitable for storing structured data. The cornerstone of data storage, all data depends on it.
Reactive frontend framework, providing Composition API, better type support and performance. Use the latest framework to write the most elegant code.
Static type checking, improving code quality and development efficiency. Make bugs nowhere to hide.
Modern frontend build tool, providing fast development experience and optimized production build. Top-notch development experience, lightning-fast startup speed.
Official state management library for Vue 3, simple and easy to use, supporting TypeScript. State management, it's that simple.
Official routing management library for Vue, supporting component-level routing and nested routing. Page navigation, effortless.
Utility-first CSS framework, improving style development efficiency, supporting responsive design. No need to write a bunch of CSS files anymore.
Customizable UI component library, based on Tailwind CSS, providing modern design style. Beautiful interface, smooth interaction.
Efficient package manager, supporting Monorepo structure, saving disk space and installation time. Faster than npm, everyone who uses it says it's good.

Tagtag backend follows a strict multi-module architecture to separate infrastructure, business logic, and API definitions. This design makes the system's components have clear responsibilities, facilitating maintenance and extension. Simply put, it's about clarifying responsibilities - each part does its job without interfering with others.
: The following descriptions are based on the directory structure after
The backend project is organized into the following layers:
, can be used independently of the Spring framework.
This layer is like a toolbox containing various tools that anyone can use without worrying about dependencies.
Infrastructure integration. This layer depends on Spring Boot and other third-party libraries, providing technical support for upper layers.
This layer is like the foundation, providing stable technical support for upper layers. Without this layer, the upper layers cannot be built.
Core business support logic. Provides common support and extension points needed for business development.
This layer is like core business rules, defining the basic norms and constraints for business development.
Defines interfaces and data structures between modules, adopting contract-first design.
: Data Transfer Objects used for API input/output.
: Java interfaces defining the service contracts.
: View Objects, used for data encapsulation for frontend display.
This layer is like a contract, defining the interfaces and data structures between parties (modules). With a contract, everyone knows how to cooperate.
The actual business implementation, each module corresponds to a specific business domain.
: Handle HTTP requests, call service layer.
This layer is like various departments, each department responsible for its own business, each doing its own job.
Application entry point. Aggregates all modules and provides configuration files.
This layer is like the company gate, all modules enter and exit from here.

: Each module is responsible for only one business domain, and modules communicate through the contract layer. Like various departments, each doing its own job, cooperating through contracts (contract layer).
: High-level modules depend on abstractions, not on concrete implementations. Like a boss depends on contracts, not on specific employees.
: Open for extension, closed for modification. Like software upgrades, you can add new features but cannot change old functionality.
: Each class and method is responsible for only one function. Like a person only responsible for one thing, won't do everything.
: Strictly follow layered architecture, no cross-layer calls. Like company hierarchy, cannot skip levels to report.
Tagtag frontend adopts a modern Monorepo structure, built on
framework, aiming to provide an efficient, scalable frontend development experience. Simply put, it's about organizing frontend code in an orderly manner for easy management and maintenance.
Reactive frontend framework, providing Composition API. Use the latest framework to write the most elegant code.
Static type checking, improving code quality. Make bugs nowhere to hide.
Modern frontend build tool, providing fast development experience. Top-notch development experience, lightning-fast startup speed.
Official state management library for Vue 3. State management, it's that simple.
Official routing management library for Vue. Page navigation, effortless.
Utility-first CSS framework, improving style development efficiency. No need to write a bunch of CSS files anymore.
Customizable UI component library, based on Tailwind CSS. Beautiful interface, smooth interaction.
Efficient package manager, supporting Monorepo structure. Faster than npm, everyone who uses it says it's good.
The frontend project is mainly divided into three layers:
Contains specific application implementations, each subdirectory corresponds to an independent frontend application.
: Main application, containing complete business logic and interface.
Provides reusable core functions and components for the application layer.
: Basic design system, icons and shared tools.
: Basic components based on Shadcn UI.
: Popup, drawer and other component encapsulation.
: Business side effects and logic encapsulation.
Provides tools and configuration for building, development and maintenance.
: ESLint, Prettier, Stylelint and other code style configuration.
: Split UI into reusable components to improve code reusability.
: Separation of business logic, UI display and state management.
: Code splitting, lazy loading, virtual scrolling and other optimization methods.
: Ensure the application is accessible to all users, including people with disabilities.
: Multiple applications can share components, utility classes and configurations.
: All applications use the same version of dependencies, avoiding version conflicts.
: Shared build configurations and scripts, improving development efficiency.
: Team members can share and reuse code more conveniently.
: Unified version number management, simplifying release process.
